title: Sports People; 2 Steelers Retire
description: John Stallworth, a wide receiver, and Donnie Shell, a safety, are retiring after 14 seasons with the Pittsburgh Steelers. A team spokesman said yesterday that the Steelers will announce plans on Friday to honor the 35-year-old veterans of Pittsburgh's Super Bowl victories in 1975, 1976, 1979 and 1980. After the 1980 triumph, there were 21 Steelers who played on the four Super Bowl teams. Now, only Mike Webster, the center, who plans to return next fall for his 15th season, remains from those squads. Stallworth, who holds six Steeler receiving records, had 537 career catches and is ranked 11th in the league in yards gained in a career with 8,723. Shell, who took part in five Pro Bowls and was Pittsburgh's most valuable player in 1980, holds the National Football League record for most interceptions by a safety, 51.

title: A Nutrasweet Product Is Due
description: The Nutrasweet Company is planning to announce the development of a fat substitute that could reduce calories and cholesterol in many foods, according to a report published in Crain's Chicago Business, a weekly publication. The company declined to comment, but a spokesman said Nutrasweet had scheduled a news conference in New York on Jan. 27 to announce a ''major revolution in food.''

description: A convicted rapist who maintains that his lawyer cheated on a deal to bribe his judge has been granted a new trial and is free on $50,000 bond.

description: NO one can get blood from a turnip, but it might prove possible to find the blood substance hemoglobin in one.

description: Herman Badillo and a group of investors have applied for a New York State banking charter and Federal regulatory permission to create a bank run primarily by and for Hispanic people.

title: Rabin Vows to Quell Palestinian Unrest
description: Defense Minister Yitzhak Rabin said today that the disturbances in the occupied West Bank and Gaza Strip were the most difficult and widespread that Israel had yet faced, but he vowed to bring the unrest to a ''manageable'' level.

title: 3 Bystanders Foil Robbery at BMT Station
description: Three bystanders seized two men who threw a woman against a wall and grabbed her wallet at a busy midtown subway station yesterday afternoon, the transit police said.

title: New Zealand Inflation
description: New Zealand's inflation rate has dropped below 10 percent for the first time in more than 14 years, according to figures released today by the Government. The consumer price index rose 9.6 percent in 1987, down from 18.2 percent in 1986. The annual rate was slightly lower than that forecast by the Labor Party Government.

title: Belgian Giant Sought By Italian-Led Group
description: In what Belgians view as an assault on their nation, a Paris-based investment group headed by Carlo de Benedetti, the Italian financier, said today that it was starting a bid for control of Societe Generale de Belgique, a holding company that is synonymous with Belgium.

description: A sex offender who was granted probation on the condition that he post a warning sign on his door has become a fugitive since a judge told him to move because he was living too close to an elementary school.

description: Walter L. Strauss, a writer, publisher and authority on Old Master drawings and prints, died of a heart attack last Thursday at Madison Avenue and 56th Street. He was 65 years old and lived in Scarborough, N.Y.

description: Panama's military leader has dismissed a close adviser who had been trying to arrange a transition to true civilian rule, senior Latin American diplomats said tonight.

title: France Plans Sale Of Matra
description: After suspending France's privatization program in reaction to last October's stock market plunge, France's Finance Minister, Edouard Balladur, announced today that the Government would resume the program by selling off its 51 percent interest in the Matra Group, one of France's largest makers of military and electronic equipment.

title: Radioactive Powder Leaks
description: About 200 pounds of a low-level radioactive powder leaked early today from a rooftop vent at a federally owned uranium-processing plant, officials said. Contamination from the uranium powder appeared limited to the immediate area and no trace was detected outside the 1,050-acre plant site, said Pete Kelley of the Westinghouse Materials Company of Ohio. The company processes uranium for reactors and weapons.

title: Advertising; Network and Spot TV Ads for 'Platoon' Video
description: You'll be seeing it soon on network and spot TV. The screen will be full of action-packed scenes from ''Platoon,'' the hit film of the war in Vietnam, when across the bottom of the tube will crawl one of those print bands that is usually the station or network's way of announcing real news. It will say: ''America. Wait no more. At last your video store has Platoon. Platoon at last.''

title: Bork Not Expected to Return To Full-Time Teaching Post
description: Judge Robert H. Bork, who failed to win Senate confirmation to the United States Supreme Court, probably will not return to teaching full time at Yale University after he steps down from the bench, the dean of the Yale Law School said today.

title: Andrija Artukovic, 88, Nazi Ally Deported to Yugoslavia, Is Dead
description: Andrija Artukovic, a former leader of the Nazi puppet state of Croatia who was extradited from the United States to Yugoslavia, died Saturday in a prison hospital in Zagreb, where he had been condemned to death for mass murder, the Yugoslav press agency announced yesterday. He was 88 years old and had won a stay of execution on the ground of poor health.

title: Sportswear Stays Up Later and Becomes Dressier
description: Sportswear isn't sportswear any more. Instead of navy blazers, tailored shirts and gray flannel pants, it's plunging necklines, chiffon skirts and lace T-shirts. This indigenous branch of American fashion is changing its nature. Instead of sportswear's traditional sturdy, casual look, the clothes are flirty, feminine and infinitely dressier.

title: A Woman's Fabled Soft Spot for the Cast-Iron City
description: She helped save the iron-clad architecture of an earlier New York, but sees no reason to rest. Margot Gayle is still a passionate and ubiquitous lobbyist for the city's 19th-century esthetic patrimony.

title: Give Help Instead

title: Theater Owner In Venture Talks
description: AMC Entertainment Inc., one of the nation's largest movie theater chains, said it had been negotiating to form a venture to run the theaters it now operates in a major Northeastern metropolitan area. AMC said only that the company with which it was negotiating was a major entertainment company.

title: Carbide Files India Appeal
description: The Union Carbide Corporation today appealed a court decision that ordered it to pay $270 million in interim relief to victims of the 1984 gas leak that killed more than 2,800 people.

title: San Juan Journal; Violence Turns Don Juan Tale Ugly
description: His name is Antonio Garcia Lopez but in the rugged Central Cordillera he is better known as Tono Bicicleta - Tony Bicycle. Police helicopters this week circled over the mountains' green ridges, dense and wet, probing into the shadowy pockets where he might be hiding.

description: The symbolism did not escape Doug Williams today. On the morning after he achieved the high point of his professional football career, he was the grand marshal of the Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. parade in Washington. And although the game he plays for a living may appear insignificant on a day like this, Williams found King's words appropriate to describe his feelings about reaching the Super Bowl.

IU's shares rose 87.5 cents today, to $19.375, on the New York Stock Exchange amid speculation that Neoax would increase its offer.

title: Music: Shostakovich 14th
description: THE 14th Symphony of Dmitri Shostakovich, played at the 92d Street Y Sunday afternoon by the New York Chamber Symphony under the composer's son, Maxim, is a cycle of 11 songs on the subject of death. The texts are by Lorca, Apollinaire, Kuchelbecher and Rilke, set for soprano and bass soloists. It is an important, difficult work, and any performance of it is a significant event.

title: KEY RATES
300,000 Sign Petitions For New Arizona Vote
description: As state legislative leaders prepared to consider the impeachment of Gov. Evan Mecham, county officials from around the state reported today that enough signatures had been validated on petitions to force an election to remove him from office.

title: Iron From Exploding Star
description: Observations made by astronomers aboard a high-flying airplane have found an extremely unusual form of iron in the debris ejected by an exploding star. The existence of this type of iron, scientists say, implies that the temperature of the explosion must have been even higher than previously suspected.

description: In a new, previously unpublished poem that has found its way to the United States, the Soviet poet Yevgeny Yevtushenko expresses a vivid admiration and compassion for Nikolai I. Bukharin, the Bolshevik leader who was executed on Stalin's orders in 1938.

description: A House committee chairman has quietly prevented the Army Corps of Engineers from selling an executive jet that has been used by members of Congress and called wasteful by the Army's auditors.

description: Engineers of the General Motors Corporation recommended in an internal memorandum that the company's 1986-87 H-body cars be recalled to fix problems that cause the throttles to stick open, according to company documents cited today by a consumer advocacy group.

description: Ten years later, Bretons remember the catastrophe they call La Maree Noire, the Black Tide, with the intensity with which Americans recall the moment President Kennedy was shot.

title: Robertson Seeks the Faithful In Cross-State Tour of Iowa
description: Pat Robertson campaigned from border to border across Iowa today, stopping his specially equipped bus at small towns, preaching his message of moral values and trying to energize Iowans to support him in the state's Republican Presidential caucuses three weeks from today.

title: STUDY AFFIRMS LINK OF PERSONALITY TO ILLNESS
description: A MAJOR new study links personality traits with illness on such a broad scale that some psychologists depict being neurotic as a key factor in susceptibility to disease.

title: Hoffman Lifts Sterling Bid; Suitors Seen
description: Hoffmann-La Roche & Company announced last night that it was raising its hostile takeover offer for Sterling Drug Inc. to nearly $4.4 billion, hours after Sterling rejected its initial $4.2 billion bid.

title: China's Car Output Up
description: China produced 445,000 cars in 1987, up more than 20 percent from 369,000 in 1986, the New China News Agency said today. Domestic sales in the first nine months of 1987 came to 319,000 vehicles, up 40 percent over the 1986 period, the agency said.

title: HAITI GOVERNMENT PRAISES ELECTION
description: The army-dominated Government defended Sunday's presidential election today as ''beautifully'' done, but several candidates charged widespread fraud and opposition leaders said irregularities and a lack of voter participation robbed the elections of credibility.

title: Vote on Contra Aid Thrown Into Turmoil
description: Nicaragua's professed willingness to suspend its state of emergency and begin direct talks with the rebels could make it harder for the Reagan Administration to get them more military aid, Democratic and Republican lawmakers and key Congressional aides say.

title: In Human Rights Court, Honduras Is First to Face Death Squad Trial
description: In the first case ever tried by the Inter-American Court on Human Rights in which a Government has been put on trial, Honduras is being accused here of maintaining army death squads that caused the ''disappearance'' of civilians suspected of being leftists.

title: ALLIED BANCSHARES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income The 1987 results include provisions to loan-loss allowances of $70 million in the fourth quarter and $355.9 million for the year, compared with $39 million and $219.4 million for the same periods, respectively.

title: Texas G.O.P. Accepts All Six for Its Primary
description: Despite widespread allegations of forged petitions that threatened to knock several candidates off the primary election ballot, Texas Republicans today reversed their position and said all six major Presidential candidates would be eligible to win delegates in the March 8 primary.

title: Advertising; A Meredith Publisher In AIDS Fund Drive
description: Stephen R. Burzon, publisher of Meredith's Metropolitan Home magazine, announced plans yesterday for a major fund-raising effort in behalf of the fight against AIDS. He hopes to be able to donate at least $300,000 to the Design Industries' Foundation for AIDS. During Designers Saturday Week in early October the magazine will have a show house on the East Side with its various rooms being done by some of the biggest names in interior decoration. It will be open to the public till the end of the month for $10 a person. In connection with the show house there will be a benefit dinner to which Mr. Burzon hopes to draw 1,000 guests.

title: Rates Little Changed Overseas
description: Interest rates were little changed in overseas trading while speculators and investors waited for the resumption of full-scale trading in the United States after yesterday's holiday.

title: Lakers Connect on 18 in Row
description: Earvin (Magic) Johnson scored 26 of his season-high 39 points in the first half and the Los Angeles Lakers made 18 straight field goals in the opening quarter on the way to a 121-110 victory today over the Houston Rockets.

title: Our Towns; A City Struggles Over an Honor For Dr. King
description: Last spring, Walter Fields got the idea to rename First Street here after the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. ''Neither the city nor Bergen County has any honor after Dr. King,'' he said. ''No street, no building, no park, no school, nothing.''

title: Ohio River Oil Spill Dispersing
description: An oil spill from a ruptured diesel fuel tank has oozed nearly 200 miles as it slowly dissipates down the Ohio River, regional officials say.

title: Sports People; Mahorn Is Punished
description: Rick Mahorn, the Detroit Pistons' power forward, was suspended without pay for one game and fined $5,000 yesterday for committing a foul that started a fight during the Saturday night game in which the Bulls defeated the Pistons. Rod Thorn, the National Basketball Association's vice president for operations, who levied the fine on Mahorn, also fined Charles Oakley, the Bulls' power forward, $2,000, and Doug Collins, the Bulls' coach, $1,500. Horace Grant, Scottie Pippen and Granville Waiters of Chicago and Vinnie Johnson and John Salley of Detroit were each fined $500.

title: TANDEM COMPUTERS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The year-ago results are restated to reflect pooling of interests with Atalla Corp., a wholly owned subsdiary, acquired through a merger in November 1987.

title: First Chicago Posts $96.5 Million Loss in Quarter
description: The First Chicago Corporation reported a $96.5 million fourth-quarter loss yesterday, largely because of a $240 million reserve against its loans to third-world nations.

title: Theory on Earth's Core
description: A geologist from the Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute has challenged a fundamental belief about conditions on the Earth when it formed 4.5 billion years ago. He says the young planet was hot at its center rather than cold.

title: Jockeying Begins as Politicians Look to Chicago Mayoral Election
description: Politicians generally like to open campaigns before crowds of cheering supporters. But Acting Mayor Eugene Sawyer, whose public appearances sometimes elicit jeers as well as cheers, chose to announce his bid in a radio studio.

title: 3d World's Prospects Called Poor
description: Investment and economic growth have contracted in debtor countries since the global debt crisis began in 1982, and living standards have staggered, the World Bank said today.

title: Advertising; SSC&B:Lintas Wins Motorola
description: SSC&B:Lintas Worldwide has won the Motorola corporate account for the United States and Europe after a six-month review of 10 agencies. The budget is $5 million. Initially, the competition included Motorola's former agency, Young & Rubicam, which had had the account since 1978. By October, however, the list came down to Lintas:New York, J. Walter Thompson USA, Chicago, and Batten, Barton, Durstine & Osborn, New York.

title: Flately Still Out Sports People
description: Patrick Flatley of the Islanders underwent tests yesterday to determine the extent of damage to his right knee, which he injured Sunday night at Buffalo when he was checked into the boards by Mike Ramsey. Ari Haanpaa was summoned from Springfield, Mass., on emergency recall to replace Flatley tonight against Pittsburgh. Bryan Trottier missed the Sunday game because of a muscle strain in the thigh and was questionable for tonight, but Brad Lauer, who was excused from yesterday's practice with a broken toe, was expected to play. Brian Curran, who was struck by a puck in Pittsburgh last Tuesday, had a metal plate inserted into the jaw, which was broken in three places.

title: Lawmakers on the Tube
description: C-SPAN, the cable television network that brings Senate and House floor sessions live into your living room, has 43 percent more viewers than it did three years ago. The public affairs network reports that a national poll by the Maryland Survey Research Center, taken in the final three months of 1987, showed 10.9 million households or a potential audience of 27.3 million people watching C-SPAN, an increase of 43 percent from the 1984 estimates of 7.6 million households and 19 million people.

title: Brand-New Net Sparks a Victory
description: Things were different for the Nets tonight in many respects. They had two new players on the roster. They had a new starting center. They had three players score more than 20 points each. And they won.

title: SCHACHER, GREENTREE & CO reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
ELECTRO-CATHETER CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
CENTRAL & SOUTH WEST CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Books of The Times
description: AFGHANISTAN, THE GREAT GAME REVISITED. Edited by Rosanne Klass. 519 pages. Freedom House.

title: Homeless Woman to Be Released After Being Forcibly Hospitalized
description: Joyce Brown, the homeless woman who challenged a Koch administration program to forcibly hospitalize mentally ill street people, will be released this week, city officials said yesterday, 12 weeks after she was picked up on an East Side sidewalk.

title: BURNHAM SERVICE CORPORATION reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
FAMILY SHOPPING NETWORK reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
ARCHER DANIELS MIDLAND CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
TRITON ENERGY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
description: b-Includes a loss of $6,594,000 from the redemption of notes.

title: PIONEER-STANDARD ELECTRONCS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $119,969 for the quarter and $529,445 for the 9 months.

title: SEAGATE TECHNOLOGY reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
MICRO MASK INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a tax credit of $332,000. c-Net loss

title: PROGRAMMING & SYSTEMS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
Sales Slip in Britain
description: Britain's consumer boom appeared to taper off at the end of last year, with retail sales falling a seasonally adjusted 1.1 percent in December after rising 1.05 percent in November, the Government said today. The Department of Trade and Industry said sales rose more than 1 percent in the October-December period from the previous quarter, and were 5.5 percent higher than in the 1986 period.

title: ELIZABETH HOLTZMAN IS NO ORDINARY LAWYER CRITICIZING A JUDGE
description: To the Editor:

title: The Debate Over Dinosaur Extinctions Takes an Unusually Rancorous Turn
description: THE impact of a large comet may or may not have killed off the dinosaurs 65 million years ago. But as the debate over dinosaur extinction rages on, personal rancor is increasingly clouding scientific issues.

title: TECHKNITS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
Shock-Wave Therapy Tested Against Gallstones
description: A DEVICE designed by West German aerospace engineers to pulverize kidney stones with shock waves is now being explored as a promising treatment for a far more common condition: gallstones.

title: Gephardt's Iowa Campaign Resurges
description: Representative Richard A. Gephardt has chalked up his 118th day of Presidential campaigning in Iowa, hoping to translate a recent upswing in his popularity into solid support at Iowa's Democratic caucuses on Feb. 8.

title: Let the Afghan Rebels Speak for Themselves
description: LEAD: With the military balance in Afghanistan tipping away from the Soviet-installed regime, it is time Pakistan yielded its role as spokesman at the negotiating table for the Afghan rebels. The rebels, having borne the brunt of the casualties of the nine-year war, have earned the right to choose their own political representative.

title: PLANTRONICS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 2
HOME SAVINGS & LOAN ASSN reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
ROLLINS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The year-ago share earnings restated for a 3-for-2 stock split in June 1987.

title: Fair Price for Integrity
description: Seeking public office in New York City has traditionally meant paying obeisance to real estate developers, brokerage houses and others who offer big contributions in hopes that the favor will be repaid once the beneficiary takes office.

title: PREMIER BANCORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
In Dispute on Bias, Stanford Is Likely To Alter Western Culture Program
description: At Stanford University, they still talk of the day nearly a year ago when some 500 students, on a march with the Rev. Jesse Jackson, came up with a slogan for the next generation.

title: The Basic Speech/Jesse Jackson; From a Tradition of Marching for Jobs and Rights
description: Candidates seeking the Presidential nomination make dozens of speeches in their campaigns. Some address a particular issue or audience in a particular way. But more often the candidate uses a ''basic speech.'' It summarizes, with little variation from one occasion to the next, how the candidate wants to present himself to the voters.

title: THE BIRTH OF QUASARS: VIOLENT COSMIC ACCIDENTS OFFER A CLUE
description: PRESSING against the limitations of their telescopes, astronomers believe they may be seeing the violent epoch of the birth of quasars, the most powerful energy sources in the sky.

title: DRUG TESTS RISING AS WAY TO REDUCE PRISON CROWDING
description: As prison and jail populations swell beyond capacity, cities and states are increasingly using drug tests to identify the worst criminal offenders, and using treatment of drug abuse to alter their criminal behavior.

title: ST PAUL BANCORPORATION INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Includes penalties of $724,000 from early payment of FHLB advances. Per share earnings for 1986 are not revelant; the company went public in May 1987.

title: Concert: Philadelphia Group
description: THE Concerto Soloists of Philadelphia played a concert at Town Hall on Sunday afternoon that was notable for its three strong 18th-century pieces. The nicest discovery was Francesco Rosetti's G minor Symphony. He was a Bohemian despite the Italian pen name, and his music here is terse and forceful - touched by the Sturm und Drang movement but with the tenseness smoothed over by the composer's elegance. C. P. E. Bach's E flat Symphony was interesting for its dramatic silences, the Haydn Symphony in D (No. 70) for the original imitative writing of its finale.

title: The U.N. Today
description: General Assembly

title: By Design: Elegant Pearls
description: A pearl necklace has always been one of the luxuries women aspire to and many have obtained. Because pearls run the gamut from fake to fabulous, a strand can range in price from $10 to $1 million.

title: NICARAGUA FREES JAILED DISSIDENTS
description: The security police today released seven opposition leaders whose arrest over the weekend provoked international protests.

title: Sharon Trustee Weighs Suit
description: The new bankruptcy trustee for the Sharon Steel Corporation, a company that was once pivotal in the takeover empire of Victor Posner, said today that he would consider legal action against the Miami financier to recover money that he says is owed to the corporation.

title: Amendment Made To Carteret Offer
description: The Home Group Inc., a New York insurance company, and Carteret Bancorp Inc., which owns the Carteret Savings Bank of Morristown, N.J., said they had amended the takeover agreement that was reached last August. Under the revised deal, Home Group's offer price was reduced to $19 a share in cash, or about $232 million, from $22.50 a share, or about $320 million.

title: BRANCH CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Includes securities losses of $574,000 for the quarter and securities gains of $813,000 for the year. c-Includes securities gains of $150,000 for the quarter and $1,218,000 for the year.

title: GENERAL MICROWAVE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 28
FLORIDA NATIONAL BANKS OF FLORIDA INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The latest fourth quarter is after provisions of $20 million for possible loan losses. The company in the fourth quarter recognized a $9.1 million pre-tax gain from the partial settlement of a pensioned benefit obligation. Substantially offsetting the gain was a special provision of $4 million to reduce Latin American loans to market value and additional income tax expenses. The year-ago quarter net is after provisions of $37.3 million for possible loan losses.

title: Sports People; Hope for Fernandez
description: Tony Fernandez's injured elbow should be healed in time for him to start the 1988 season for the Toronto Blue Jays.

title: STRATEGIC PLANNING reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
Prices of Copper Are Higher On Worry About Inventory
description: Copper futures prices advanced yesterday as concern deepened on the Commodity Exchange in New York and the London Metal Exchange about dwindling inventories of the metal. As usual, the low level of copper stocks has raised questions about how good the metal that remains in exchange warehouses is.

title: Jazz: Curlew, a Quintet
description: CURLEW, the best of the unsigned, genre-busting downtown groups, sounds a bit like Ornette Coleman's electric band, Prime Time. Instruments chatter in the background, keys get clashed, harmonized melodies appear and a saxophone often states the main themes as a question or a declaration. But where Mr. Coleman's group has a drifting, urban sense of dislocation, with instruments rarely coming into sync, Curlew sounds rural, happy - the group traffics in joy.

title: The Dance: Hannah Kahn
description: THE catholicity of Hannah Kahn's musical taste was evident in the recently choreographed works that the Hannah Kahn Dance Company brought to the Merce Cunningham Studio Sunday night. But the program also revealed something curious about her method of dance composition.

title: CRESTAR FINANCIAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The company said the decline in earnings is largely because of an additional $10.5 million special provision for Latin American loans.

title: New Research Yields Clues in Fight Against Autoimmune Diseases
description: WITH a newly detailed picture of molecules on the surfaces of cells, scientists are hopeful that they can finally devise strategies against the 40 or more diseases that result when the immune system mistakenly turns against the body.

title: MICOM SYSTEMS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The year-ago results are restated to reflect the pooling of interest acquisitions of International Software Database Corp. and Spectrum Digital Corp., acquired in May 1987 and December 1987, respectively.

title: SHELTON SAVINGS & LOAN ASSOCIATION reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The company said the earnings decline primarily was the result of weakened loan demand and one-time expenses related to its conversion from FSLIC to FDIC deposit insurance.

title: CREDO PETROLEUM CORP reports earnings for Year to Oct 31
description: b-Includes a tax credit of $18,000. c-Net loss The company said fiscal 1986 results include a writedown of oil and gas properties of $1,479,000.

title: Vintage Musicals in Revival
description: When a 29-piece orchestra strikes up the overture to Jerome Kern's 1920 show ''Sally'' tomorrow evening at the Academy Theater, the sound of music will herald the revitalization of the New Amsterdam Theater Company, the only theater organization in New York devoted full time to the concert restoration of vintage American musicals.

title: EVANS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 28
description: b-Net income

title: Haitians Quietly Awaiting Results and the Reaction
description: The heavy downtown traffic signaled a return to normal here today after a day of closed stores and roadblocks.

title: NBD BANCORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The provision for possible loan losses in 1987 increased to $115.1 million, compared with $19.2 million a year ago. The bank said special provisions for Latin American loans and other possible credit losses reduced after-tax earnings by $32.4 million for the year.

title: Corrections
description: The Our Towns column on Dec. 29 misstated the frequency of volunteers' meetings with recovering mental patients in the Compeer program operated by the Mental Health Association of Nassau County. They meet once a week for one year.

title: The Dance: New Works By 6 Choreographers
description: DANCE CHANCE, a producing organization directed by Patricia Tarr, celebrated its fifth anniversary with two selections of new dance at the Bessie Schonberg Theater. The previously reviewed first program and the second program, seen on Saturday night, suggested both the adventurousness and soundness of Dance Chance's plan. The six choreographers represented were for the most part established and popular young dancers with equally established and popular modern dance troupes. And it was a good idea to put together an evening with a single dance by each. But Saturday's program, like the first selection, made one wonder whether a cult of personality may be diminishing or replacing the kinds of sound choreographic and theatrical values that have nourished modern dance over the past few decades.

title: CONCHEMCO INC reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
EA ENGINEERING, SCIENCE & TECHNOLOGY reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
FRANKLIN SAVINGS & LOAN ASSN reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Sports People; Center of Attention
description: The Rangers have given Mark Janssens, their fourth choice in the 1986 draft, a five-game tryout that will start tonight against the Kings in Los Angeles. Janssens, a center, is in his last year of junior eligibility with the Regina Pats of the Western Hockey League, where he has 23 goals and 27 assists in 43 games. . . . The Devils said that Perry Anderson, who suffered a concussion in the first period during the loss to the Islanders Saturday, was questionable for the game tonight against the Capitals.

title: Kaypro's New PC
description: IT was the only sensible decision, but that didn't make it any pleasanter. Saying farewell to a faithful retainer is never easy. Still, it had to be done, and so we pulled the plug on the old Kaypro II, closed its cover, and sent it away.

title: FINANCIAL NEWS NETWORK reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
Bethlehem Sets Price Increases
description: The Bethlehem Steel Corporation will increase its prices from $20 and $30 a ton on certain steel products. The steelmaker increased its base price for carbon and other brands of its steel plates by $20 a ton, or 4.5 percent, to $465 a ton, Gary Graham, a spokesman for the nation's third-largest steel producer, said. These plate products are used in construction and heavy machinery.

title: N.F.L. Playoffs; Broncos Eager to Bury Their Bitterness
description: Finally, John Elway said today, he realizes that the Super Bowl ''is just another football game.''

title: French Pupil Ordered Home
description: A foreign exchange student has been ordered to return to France because she visited her homeland for Christmas week instead of staying to watch Americans celebrate the holidays.

title: A. H. Robins Receives New Round of Offers
description: The A. H. Robins Company yesterday received a new round of competing takeover bids from the American Home Products Corporation, the Rorer Group Inc., and Sanofi S.A. of France. But a special meeting of the Robins board to choose among the bids was adjourned until today to give financial advisers time to study the details.

title: TUESDAY, JANUARY 19, 1988   ; International
description: Investment and growth have contracted in debtor countries since the global debt crisis began in 1982, and living standards have slumped badly, the World Bank said. Prospects for any near-term improvements are bleak, the bank said in a report that is the most pessimistic it has ever issued on the debt crisis. The report shows that third world debt grew 6.25 percent last year, to $1.190 trillion. The World Bank said the debt burden had reduced consumption in the developing nations. [ Page D1. ]

title: SEEQ TECHNOLOGY reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Includes a tax credit of $512,000. c-Net loss The company said revenue for the 1987 fiscal first quarter includes $1 million from an engineering development arrangement with Motorola Semiconductor Products of Phoenix, Ariz.

title: KEYCORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Norway-China Oil Talks
description: Norway's state oil company, Statoil, said today that it was close to reaching an agreement with China to lead a search for oil in the South China Sea. Haakon Lavik, a spokesman for Statoil, said the agreement would make Statoil the main operator in a 1,450-square-mile tract south of Hainan island. Statoil and the Chinese National Offshore Oil Corporation will each have a 50 percent stake in the area.

title: PLANTERS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The year-ago per share earnings are restated to reflect a 3-for-2 stock split.

title: SQUARE INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
description: b-Includes a gain on the sale of a parking facility of $854,000, or 73 cents a share.

title: Protests, Politics and Deep Emotion Mix as New York Honors Dr. King
description: From Brooklyn to the World Trade Center, from Harlem to City Hall, protesters, politicians, worshipers and workers honored the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. yesterday. They did so with warmth, with criticism, with anger and with politics, in ways that the slain civil rights leader might have understood and in ways that he might not have appreciated.

title: SILICON SYSTEMS reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
CROSS & TRECKER CORPORATION reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Includes a loss of $779,000 from discontinued operations.

title: S.A.S. to Buy 9 Boeing Jets
description: The Boeing Company won a $660 million contract today from the Scandinavian Airlines System for nine twin-engined 767 jets, wresting a major sale from Airbus Industrie, the European consortium, and the McDonnell Douglas Corporation.

title: NATIONAL COMMUNITY BANK OF NEW JERSEY reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Share earnings reflect a 4-for-1 stock split paid in May. Prior-year results are restated to reflect the adoption of FASB No. 91.

title: Executive Changes
description: Central and South West Corp., Dallas, a holding company engaged in electricity, elected as a director James M. Moroney Jr., chairman of the executive committee at A. H. Belo Corp., Dallas, a newspaper publishing and broadcasting concern.

title: Macintosh on Stage
description: A new generation of desktop laser printers, a plug-in board that allows the Macintosh SE to work in color and a software package that allows Macintosh II computers to run I.B.M. software were among the new-product announcements at the annual MacWorld Expo, which ended here today.

title: FIRST FEDERAL SAVINGS & LOAN OF COEUR D'ALENE reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Stocks Up by 7.79 in Quiet Trading
description: Stock prices rose moderately yesterday in quiet holiday trading. The Dow Jones industrial average advanced 7.79 points, to 1,963.86, after rising by 39.96 points on Friday.

title: Advertising; People
description: Ira Berkowitz has become president of Beaumont-Bennett, a sales promotion agency subsidiary of Grey Advertising.

title: AMERICAN LIST CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
Drug Prevention Project Enlists Girls' Peers
description: The Girls Clubs of America is undertaking a nationwide program to prevent drug and alcohol abuse among girls 10 to 14 years old. The goal of the Government-financed program is to reach at least 35,000 girls in the next five years.

title: China Buying Plant Line
description: China's General Internal Combustion Engine Factory in Beijing has agreed to buy a second-hand assembly line from the General Motors Corporation for $16.5 million, the official New China News Agency said today. The engine-making line, which was closed in 1984 after two years of operation, is to start running in Beijing in 1990.

title: BIRTCHER CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss

title: There's Gold in Archival Labyrinth
description: The vast labyrinth of public records and archival repositories in the nation's capital has long been a gold mine for historians and other scholars. But now a new type of investigator is discovering gold there.

title: HARLAND, JOHN H CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
CRIME DATA SHOW LOW JAILING RATE
description: Barely one-third of the people arrested on felony charges in 11 states went to jail, and only a third of those convicted of violent crimes were sentenced to more than a year, a Justice Department survey found.

title: GENDEX CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Includes extraordinary credits of $35,000 and $84,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively.

title: SECOND NATIONAL FEDERAL SAVINGS BANK reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Avon Sells Foster Unit To Abbey Medical
description: Avon Products Inc. said yesterday that it was selling its Foster Home Health Care division to Abbey Medical Inc. for $228 million, in the latest of several changes in the home health-care industry.

title: STERLING ELECTRONICS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 2
description: b-Includes a tax credit of $165,900 and $250,200 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively. c-Net loss

title: 108 Killed as Turboprop Plane Crashes in China
description: A domestic airliner crashed in southwestern China, killing all 108 people aboard, the official New China News Agency reported today.

title: DYNATRONICS LASER reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss

title: Gas Supplies Are Restored
description: Helped by a warming trend and fewer supply disruptions than expected, the nation's largest natural gas utility restored shipments today to 850 corporate customers in Southern California. The service had been cut off two weeks ago to avert a shortage to residential customers. The Southern California Gas

title: How Nature May Draw Stone Circles
description: THE ''sorted circles of Spitsbergen,'' mysterious rings of stone found in a cold Norwegian landscape, have long stood as evidence that nature does not always need human architects to pick up rocks and arrange them in harmonious patterns.

title: Goodbye, Student Journalism
description: LEAD: Mark Twain once reflected about Americans and their love of free speech: ''It is by the grace of God that in our country we have those three unspeakably precious things: freedom of speech, freedom of conscience, and the prudence never to practice either of them.''

title: Dyncorp Board Meets on New Bid
description: Directors of Dyncorp, a diversified technology company based in McLean, Va., have met to consider dropping one merger agreement for a sweeter rival proposal. A company spokesman said a decision was expected to be announced today.

title: Fruehauf Unit Sale
description: The Fruehauf Corporation has completed the sale of its 91 percent stake in Fruehauf Canada, a truck and trailer servicing operation, to FRH Acquisitions, an affiliate of the Trailmobile Group of Companies of Brantford, Ontario. The sale totaled about $96 million (Canadian), equal to $74.5 million (American), or about $30.20 (American) a share. Fruehauf has been trying to retire some of the debt it contracted while fighting a takeover bid in 1986.

title: William H. H. Wilkinson, Labor Administrator, 84
description: William H. H. Wilkinson, a former administrator of the New York State Department of Labor, died of prostate cancer Jan. 10 at Beth Abraham Hospital in the Bronx. He was 84 years old and lived in Hartsdale, N.Y.

title: HOME INTENSIVE CARE reports earnings for Year to Sept 30
description: In the year-ago period preferred stock dividend requirements exceeded net income.

title: More Lyme Disease Reported in Connecticut
description: The incidence of Lyme disease, the nation's most commonly reported tick-carried illness, has risen 163 percent in nine years in parts of Connecticut, the state where it was first discovered, Federal researchers have reported.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: An article in Business Day on Thursday about automobile sales for early January misstated the daily selling rate of Honda of America.

title: Pregnant Woman Dies After Swallowing Drug
description: A pregnant woman and her uncle died of drug overdoses, apparently after swallowing packets of a narcotic as the police raided an apartment here last week, a prosecutor said today.

title: MET-COIL SYSTEMS reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
description: b-Net loss

title: Angelo de Mojana, 82; Led Knights of Malta
description: Friar Angelo de Mojana di Cologna, the Grand Master of the Sovereign Order of the Knights of Malta, died of a heart attack today at his home in Rome. He was 82 years old.

title: Quotations of the Day
description: ''I wasted 12 weeks of my life in the hospital. I was not insane when they picked me up - I was homeless.'' - Joyce Brown, about to be released from forced hospitalization. [ A1:6. ] ''The lawyers won, and the patient lost.'' - Maureen McLeod, a city attorney. [ B9:5. ]

title: Doing the Impossible
description: IN WORLD War II, the Army Air Forces boasted, ''The difficult we do at once; the impossible takes a little longer.'' Dr. Richard R. Green, New York City's newly appointed Schools Chancellor, has paraphrased that confident slogan: ''No task will be evaded merely because it is impossible.''

title: BARRIS INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
description: b-Net income

title: U.S. Vetoes U.N. Move
description: The United States vetoed a Security Council resolution today that criticized Israel for its recent military attacks and other moves in southern Lebanon. Washington said the resolution lacked balance and showed insufficent concern for Israel's security needs.

title: INTERNATIONAL SHIPHOLDING CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The company said share earnings for the latest quarter and year are based upon net income less preferred stock dividends and accumulation of discount or preferred stock.

title: NCR CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Careers; Drug Testing Common for Job Seekers
description: DRUG testing of prospective employees has become almost routine at many major companies, according to results of a new survey issued by the Interface Group, a Washington recruiting concern. Meanwhile, a survey made by the University of Michigan finds that the use of cocaine among young adults has declined, perhaps partly because of fears about testing by employers.

title: BRYN MAWR BANK CORP reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: Bryn Mawr Trust Co. became a wholly owned subsidiary of Bryn Mawr Bank Corp. effective Jan. 2, 1987, as a result of a reorganiation. Under terms of the reorganization, each share of Bryn Mawr stock was converted into three shares of the holding company's stock. The company said that the year- earlier per share earnings was restated to reflect the stock conversion.

title: BANK OF DELAWARE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
INITIO INC reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
description: b-Net income

title: I.O.C. Is Upbeat As Deadline Passes
description: The head of the International Olympic Committee today criticized the decisions by North Korea and Cuba to boycott the Olympic Summer Games in Seoul, South Korea, but said he was pleased that a record number of nations would attend the Games next September.

title: 'Izzy, Did You Ask a Good Question Today?'
description: To the Editor:

title: Standoff Goes On at Polygamist's Utah Compound
description: More than 150 officers wearing fatigues and armed with automatic weapons ringed the compound of a slain polygamist today as 14 relatives, including a suspect in a church bombing, remained inside for a third day awaiting his ''resurrection.''

title: CARRIAGE INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 27
FIRST EMPIRE STATE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31

The company also said results were also restated to reflect the adoption of Financial Accounting Standard No. 91.

description: b-Includes a non-recurring gain of $400,157 on the sale of a bank branch, and a loss on the sale of securities of $143,773.

title: Knicks Outgun Hawks, 110-102
description: Dominique Wilkins of the Atlanta Hawks scored 45 points yesterday afternoon at Madison Square Garden, but it was not enough. The Knicks used 28 points from Gerald Wilkins, Dominique's younger brother, 20 from Patrick Ewing, a first triple-double from Mark Jackson and a trapping, harassing defense in the second half to win, 110-102.

title: COMMERCIAL INTERNATIONAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
description: b-Includes a gain of $148,000 from a change in the company's method of accounting for certain costs pertaining to the production of inventory. c-Net income

title: Rig Count Falls Again
description: The number of rigs drilling for oil and gas in the United States dropped again last week, falling by 48, to 1,054, Baker Hughes Inc. said today. A year ago, the rig count was 886. The Houston-based oil tool maker tallies only the number of rigs exploring for oil. The count is a widely watched barometer of drilling activity.

title: Digital Repurchase
description: The Digital Equipment Corporation said that its board had authorized the purchase of up to three million shares of its common stock, or about 2 percent of Digital's outstanding shares, for use by the company's employee stock plans. The shares would cost Digital $363 million, based on today's closing price on the New York Stock Exchange of $121 a share, up $2.50.

title: STANDARD SHARES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
description: b-After non-recurring securities gains of $2,462,000 for the quarter and $6,210,000 for the 9 months.

title: Kidnapping in Colombia
description: Leftist guerrillas kidnapped the leading candidate for mayor of Bogota today, the police said. Andres Pastrana, the 34-year-old son of former President Misael Pastrana, was reported abducted at gunpoint from his campaign headquarters. President Virgilio Barco Vargas called an emergency meeting of his Cabinet and Mayor Julio Cesar Sanchez of Bogota said a huge search had been mounted.

title: CROWN CRAFTS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 27
description: Latest third quarter includes a gain of about 10 cents a share from insurance claims to cover a reduction in manufacturing capacity due to the Aug. 19 fire at its Dalton Weaving facility.

title: A Singular U.S.-Canada Achievement
description: LEAD: Amid the preoccupation with the nuclear arms reduction treaty with the Soviet Union, the recently announced treaty with America's largest trading ally has gotten relatively scant attention.

title: Bright Light in the Harbor: S. I. Economy Flourishes
description: For much of the 1980's, New York City officials have been trying, with spotty success, to steer to the other boroughs jobs that were destined to leave Manhattan. Last year that effort stumbled badly everywhere, except on Staten Island.

title: HEI INC reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 28
description: b-Includes a tax loss carryforward of $40,000. c-Net loss

title: PATTERNS
description: One Label Ends . .

title: GENETICS INSTITUTE reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
NORTH CAROLINA FEDERAL SAVINGS & LOAN reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Results Plus; Skiing
description: Swiss Woman First: Brigitte Oertli of Switzerland won a special slalom yesterday in Saas Fee, Switzerland, for her first World Cup victory. Oertli, third after the first heat, had a superb second run and finished with a combined time of 1 minute 26.57 seconds. Vreni Schneider of Switzerland, the giant slalom world champion, went from eighth to second in the second run, finishing 23-hundredths of a second behind. (AP) Ice Hockey

title: Five Officers Are Hurt As an Elevator Plunges
description: Five police officers and four Emergency Medical Service workers were injured last night, none seriously, when an elevator in which they were riding fell six floors in an apartment building in Queens, officials said.

title: Sports of The Times; The Greek and the Preacher
description: THE REV. JESSE JACKSON and Jimmy (the Greek) Snyder -the preacher and presidential candidate along with the oddsmaker - met and appeared together on the television news Sunday, looking not so much like an odd couple, not so much like Oscar and Felix or Burns and Allen or Cheech and Chong, but more like opposite sides of a coin, Repentance and Acceptance.

title: First Medical Proton Accelerator Being Built
description: THE first machine designed to aim high-energy protons at deeply embedded cancers is finally being built - 42 years after Dr. Robert Wilson first cited the advantages of such therapy.

title: Westinghouse Net Up 9.9%
description: The Westinghouse Electric Corporation said today that its net income for the fourth quarter rose 9.9 percent, to $223.3 million, or $1.54 a share, from $203.2 million, or $1.38 a share, in the quarter a year ago.

title: Wilson Brought the League of Nations Debacle on Himself
description: To the Editor:

title: Salomon Banker Jumps To Gibbons, Green Post
description: E. Stephen Benson, a senior investment banker at Salomon Brothers Inc., is becoming the fifth general partner at Gibbons, Green, van Amerongen Inc., an investment banking firm specializing in management buyouts.

title: ELCOR CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $168,000 and $411,000 for the quarter and 6 months, respectively, and extraordinary gains of $997,000 for the quarter and $2,943,000 for the 6 months.

title: State House Detente
description: It's been years since New York State had a governor and lieutenant governor who get along as well as Mario Cuomo and Stan Lundine. Their rapport ought to inspire the Legislature to change the destructive rule that prevents a governor from choosing his own running mate.

title: DIME SAVINGS BANK-WALLINGORD reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The prior year per share amount is not available; the bank converted to stock form of ownership in July 1986.

title: KEY CO reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
description: b-Includes losses from discontinued operations of $1,277,000 and $1,524,000 for the quarter and year, respectively. c-Net income and after losses from discontinued operations of $215,000 for the quarter and $177,000 for the year.

title: Officers Ask Themselves Troubling Questions
description: For two days the military officers at the National Defense University here grappled with ethical issues of loyalty and obedience, just and unjust wars, political responsibilities and pacifism.

title: JOHN HANSON SAVINGS BANK reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
GERMANTOWN SAVINGS reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: There are no per share earnings for the year-ago periods because Germantown Savings Bank converted to a stock savings bank in April 1987 from a mutual.

title: Concert: St. Luke's and Samuel Ramey
description: AT Carnegie Hall on Sunday evening, the Orchestra of St. Luke's furthered its assertion to a place at the center of this city's concert life. It is a virtuoso ensemble, though not in the high-tech sense we tend to associate with top American orchestras, and all the more welcome for providing a contrast to them. What other local orchestra is capable of Schubert at the level of the transparent, vital, enthusiastic Sixth Symphony the St. Luke's players offered under Julius Rudel here?

title: Canadiens Triumph
description: Stephane Richer scored two third-period goals tonight as the Montreal Canadiens held on to beat Edmonton, 6-4, snapping the Oilers' seven-game unbeaten streak.

title: ARGONAUT GROUP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Includes gains of $75.9 million and $105.3 million for the quarter and year, respectively, on sales of investments. c-Includes gains on sales of investments of $1 million for the quarter and $7.1 million for the year. The company said it adopted the Financial Accounting Standards Bulletin No. 96, accounting for income taxes, in 1987. The company also said operating income and gains on sales of investments for the first three quarters of 1987 and for the 1986 year have been restated to reflect the reallocation of income tax provisions in accordance with FAS No. 96.

title: SOUTHEAST BANKING CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Southeast, in the latest fourth quarter, made a special provision of $10.5 million to the company's reserve for possible credit losses related to credits to developing countries. It also reported a $40 million chargeoff related to certain loans to lesser developed countries. The earnings also reflected a $10.5 million tax credit related to the special provisions. The latest year's earnings reflected a net reduction of $68 million, or $2.36 per share, stemming from two special provisions for possible credit losses related to credits to developing countries.

title: TECO ENERGY reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Transactions; BASEBALL
description: CHICAGO (AL) - Agreed to terms with Ozzie Guillen, shortstop, and Greg Walker, first baseman, on one-year contracts.

title: GULL INC reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
Panel Sees Abuse in Phone Bids
description: A Senate committee said yesterday that it had evidence that an official of the General Services Administration had passed secret bid information to at least two competing telephone companies.

title: ULTRA BANCORP reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
BURLINGTON COAT FACTORY WAREHOUSE reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
67 Laureates Consider the Century's Legacy
description: An unusual conference of Nobel laureates, summoned by President Francois Mitterrand and Elie Wiesel, gathered here today to ponder the perils and promises that confront mankind with the 21st century just 12 years away.

title: Argentine Troops Storm Garrison And Put Down Colonel's Mutiny
description: About 2,000 soldiers loyal to the civilian Government stormed an army compound today and forced the surrender of a rebellious colonel who had held the camp for three days with the support of about 100 followers, officials said.

title: Joseph Conlon, Corporate Manager, 76
description: Joseph Conlon, a former general manager of the dyestuff chemical division of the GAF Corporation in New York City, died Jan. 11 at the Hospital of the University of Pennsylvania in Philadelphia after a brief illness. He was 76 years old and had lived in West Chester, Pa., since his retirement in 1970.

title: The Devotion of Judge Weinfeld
description: Edward Weinfeld, who died Sunday at the age of 86, was the most admired judge on the Federal bench. His sense of fairness, earnestness and commitment to doing justice were conspicuous. His deep study and conscientious preparation won the respect and affection of lawyers - and inspired them to try to meet his standards. ''When you're in his court,'' said one practitioner, ''you know you're before the bar of justice.''

title: FRIES ENTERTAINMENT reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
description: b-Includes a one-time $3 million provision for doubtful accounts and a $400,000 write-off of costs related to a terminated acquisition.

title:
Market Place;
Raising Margins On Index Futures
description: LEAD: TO Chicago's futures industry, the most controversial proposal contained in the Presidential panel's report on the October market collapse is that margins should be made consistent across markets as a way to avoid another stock market free fall.

title: Why Yonkers? Long Path to an Integration Order
description: The desegregation case that has preoccupied three city administrations at a cost of $10 million is entering its eighth year with a hint of settlement, but also with many here still asking, why Yonkers?

title: Candelaria Joins Yanks as No. 3 Starter
description: The Yankees may have bolstered their corps of starting pitchers yesterday by adding John Candelaria to their staff. General Manager Lou Piniella immediately pronounced Candelaria the team's third starter, but questions existed over how effective the left-hander might be.

title: White of Illinois Resigns
description: Mike White, the head football coach at the University of Illinois, resigned today following an investigation by the National Collegiate Athletic Association into purported recruiting violations, a university spokeswoman said.

title: BAYBANKS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After an extraordinary credit of $4,820,000 from cumulative effect of change in accounting.

title: BUSH ON OFFENSIVE AGAINST 2 RIVALS
description: The sounds coming from Vice President Bush these days are growls of attack.

title: Simple Method Found To Warm Cold Hands
description: A simple and inexpensive method of training the body to change the way it reacts to cold has proven highly successful in curing victims of a little-known disease that cuts circulation to the hands in cold weather, according to a researcher for the Army.

title: IN RETIRING, REP. LUJAN PUTS NEW MEXICO IN TURMULT
description: Ever since Manuel Lujan Jr., the Republican Representative from New Mexico's First Congressional District, announced that he would not seek an 11th term, the state's political life has been in turmoil.

title: FEDERAL SAVINGS OF PUERTO RICO reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: The prior year net excludes non- business income of $2.9 million from settlement of a lawsuit.

title: APPLIED MAGNETICS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Share earnings and shares outstanding reflect a 2-for-1 stock split for shareholders of record Nov. 2.

title: Despite Gains, U.S. Businesses Fear Expansion
description: American industry is showing an unusual reluctance to build new factories - even though a growing number of companies are hard pressed to meet a rising demand for their products at home and abroad, according to economists and Commerce Department statistics.

title: CBS Says People Meter Errors Cause Big Losses
description: The new ''people meter'' system of measuring television audiences, meant to be a revolutionary breakthrough in determining who is watching which programs, has already cost the three major networks $40 million to $50 million in lost advertising revenues because of errors in the system, according to several executives at one of the networks.

title: Must Drug Terror Rule in Colombia?
description: Terrorism's grip on the judiciary in Colombia must be broken. Terrorism flouts the good intentions of President Virglio Barco, sets free that country's biggest drug dealer, Jorge Ochoa, and destroys bilateral cooperation on drugs. If one individual is most responsible for the flood of cocaine into the United States and the violence and crime linked with it, it would be Mr. Ochoa.

title: Begun Leaves Soviet, Ending 17-Year Emigration Struggle
description: Iosif Begun flew out of Moscow bound for Israel today, ending a 17-year emigration battle that included years in prison and Siberian exile.

title: 48 Black Writers Protest By Praising Morrison
description: Forty-eight black writers and critics have signed a statement deploring the fact that Toni Morrison has not won a National Book Award or the Pulitzer Prize - something they attribute to ''oversight and harmful whimsy.''

title: A Place for Homeless
description: Representative Charles E. Schumer has come up with a surefire way to bring the Federal Government closer to the problem of homelessness: Turn the headquarters of the Department of Housing and Urban Development into a shelter.

title: Elizabeth Holtzman Is No Ordinary Lawyer Criticizing a Judge
description: To the Editor:

title: CENTRAL BANCSHARES OF THE SOUTH INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
NCNB CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The latest fourth quarter earnings reflect an after-tax charge of $36 million for special provision for losses on Mexican loans. The latest year earnings reflected a total charge of $37.3 million, after taxes, from a special provision for losses and chargeoffs of Latin American debt.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: An article in Business Day yesterday about the Pan Am Corporation contained a reference that incorrectly stated the position of the Independent Union of Flight Attendants on one of the company's top executives. The union is seeking the ouster of the current management, including Martin R. Shugrue Jr., vice chairman; it has not sent a letter to the board in his support.

title: Murdoch Raises Stake in Pearson
description: The News Corporation, owned by Rupert Murdoch, has increased its stake in the Pearson Group P.L.C., a diversified British company that publishes The Financial Times, to 20.4 percent, from 19.8 percent. The Australian media company and its subsidiaries now hold 44.20 million Pearson shares, Pearson said.

title: Q&A
description: Q.How is the wind-chill factor calculated?

Recital: Mitsuko Shirai Sings
description: MITSUKO SHIRAI, accompanied by her husband, Hartmut Holl, brought to Alice Tully Hall Sunday night a lieder program invested with unusual care and thoughtfulness. First there was the music itself - mostly from familiar composers but chosen with an ear for freshness.

The company said earnings for the fourth quarter were reduced by about $1.1 million by adjustments in tax accruals and by securities losses incurred to take advantage of the higher 1987 tax rate.

title: NEW YORKERS SAY RACE RELATIONS HAVE WORSENED IN THE LAST YEAR
description: New Yorkers say they believe relations between blacks and whites are ''generally bad'' in the city and have worsened in the last year, according to a New York Times/WCBS-TV News Poll.

title: TANDY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
RAISE G.O.P. HOPES FOR ELECTION YEAR
description: The latest reports on the economy, including signs that the trade deficit is finally shrinking, have raised Republican hopes that the economy is settling onto a course that enhances the prospects of the party's candidates.

title: Tax Returns Here to Stay
description: President Reagan's dream of a tax system in which most people would not have to file returns apparently is not to be.

title: TV Review; 'Things My Mother Told Me'
description: OFTEN dabbling in sensitive subjects, the kind that fit easily into tidy object lessons, programs for younger viewers can occasionally topple over into heavy-handed theatrics. Take for instance ''Things My Mother Told Me,'' tomorrow's ''Afterschool Special'' on ABC at 4 o'clock. Eager to insure that viewers don't miss the point, the little drama is exaggerated to the point of possibly inducing hives.

title: Angelo de Mojana, 82; Led Knights of Malta
description: Friar Angelo de Mojana di Cologna, the Grand Master of the Sovereign Order of the Knights of Malta, died of a heart attack Monday at his home in Rome. He was 82 years old.

title: Navratilova, Evert To Meet 76th Time
description: Martina Navratilova and Chris Evert will meet in the semifinals of the Australian Open, the 76th time they will face each other.

title: FIRST CITIZENS BANCSHARES reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Trust and a Fortune Cookie: Blind Date Is Back in Fashion
description: It was a blind date. They decided to meet by the Dumpster in front of Jeremy's Ale House, a popular hangout at South Street Seaport. Expectations were low.

title: CENTRUST SAVINGS BANK reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
EVERGREEN BANCORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
AMERIFIRST FEDERAL SAVINGS & LOAN ASSN reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Includes income from discontinued operations of $335,000 for the latest quarter and $216,000 for the year- earlier period. The company went public during the year-ago first fiscal quarter.

title: A Choice for Polish Draftees
description: The Government said today that it would formally propose legislation to introduce substitute service for youths who refuse to go in the army.
